Loud, and not in a good way, with a lot of families with small kids.  Maybe we went at the wrong time.  Also, the place is BYOB, which we found to our dimay when we tried to order a bottle of Saki.  Is that their fault? No, but it put a damper on dinner.  All in all, find a different place for sushi.

Makiman Sushi is a great place to go for a group. I've taken several groups here for different occasions and it never fails to please. The atmosphere is nice but still cozy, the food is awesome and beautiful, and the staff is attentive. My friends ordered the party boat, which is fun because of how grand the sushi's wooden boat looks. Their scallion pancake is pretty good, a little softer than a traditional Chinese one. I like their specialty rolls, especially the tempura shrimp, tempura sweet potatoes, and eel and avocado rolls. You can't go wrong with green tea ice cream either. To top it all off, sometimes the manager sends out a free dish for the table.

I've been here a few times now. Overall, the sushi is just ok, nothing spectacular. I did take out a few weeks ago for a special roll that was pretty much just a california roll with salmon, crunch, and spicy sauce, and it was ridiculously over priced. Good for large groups if you're looking for a last minute BYO, but otherwise I wouldn't recommend it.

I love Makiman! Risque tagline? Maybe. Fantastic sushi? Yes!

I really like the menu here because there is a mix of traditional, specialty, and veggie rolls. This is a place where I can take my veggie/vegan friends and everyone will still be satisfied. I often find myself stealing a veggie roll from a friend because it's so tasty! You've got to try one of the rolls with sweet potato - delish!

The only roll I've tried that I didn't like was the MM Naruto. It's wrapped in cucumber instead of rice. It left me hungry. Such a letdown.

I used to live right across from Makiman and had their take out whenever I didn't want to cook. It's pretty good Korean food (I'm not really a sushi person) for a reasonable price. 

The lunch specials are a great deal too!

I come with  my friend in here two time,fist time is ok ,this time some fish no fresh at all,I just tried for fish no fresh,service is ok.roll is too small,No more rice from the roll,thanks..........
..

Makiman sushi, what a pleasant surpise you are! Jost got a take out form this new place. Eel teriyaki was fantastic! Started with a perfect miso( best ever), an ok salad and then OMG! Eel was perfectly tender, crispy on the outside, nicely seasoned(if a bit too sweet), and it came with well cooked brown rice and onions, which just melted in my mouth, some (caramelized?) potatoes, which exploded with flavor( I don't even like potatoes!). We also had a sushi and sashimi platter( only ordered a sushi combo, but it was delicious anyway). I would definately recommend this place. Good prices for the quality and quantity. Keep on the good work.

Sushi was great but unfortunately the service was awkward.  I say awkward because they were attentive but in the wrong way.

I went here with a friend for dinner, used a Groupon deal which was worth it but the hostess/server was all over the place. They were really nice girls but they constantly wanted to remove plates that I was still working on.  I felt kind of rushed eating it since I felt like they were going to come take my plates away when there was obviously food on it.

I think I'll stick to take out from this place to avoid the awkward dining experience I had the other day.

After my favorite Sushi place closed down earlier this year I embarked on a journey to find a new spot. I had heard some good things about Makiman so I decided to give them a try... I now regret that decision. My friend and I were sat down and then ignored for 15 minutes before someone came to take our order. We ordered one of their sushi boats and when it finally arrive almost 45 minutes later it was terribly disappointing. Nothing tasted fresh and when added to the poor service this is a definite skip me in the future.

with my living social deal in hand we headed over here on a sunday afternoon. Walking up the street I realize, OH wait! this is where MUNTIN used to be *sigh* . so we go in and are immediately greeted . We ordered the choose your own sushi dinner ... and the dinner comes with 3 rolls of your choice, miso soup, and a house salad. all for like 17! whoa! good price right? also as a starter we got the vegetable tempura. The food was great! the staff was on point the entire time which I love. I must also mention that when we sat down they immediately made some child friendly chopsticks for my daughter without even being asked to do so! LOVES IT! 

By completion we had 2 pick you owns, and the veggie tempura, all for like 44$ AFTER TAX!  thats 6 rolls, 2 soups, 2 salads and tempura.. I'm really liking those numbers! 

My one qualm was when our waitress answered the phone at the hostess booth. This is not an issue but apparently she received a personal call from a friend and spoke with them in a manner that just was not suitable front of house behavior, especially when you have customers in earshot! however she was pleasant, and exceptionally attentive! 

I'll def need to come back here, hopefully it doesn't close down like muntin did!

The sushi here is amazing. Fresh and such large pieces of sushi and sashimi. It's a small place but we have a large group and they go above and beyond to make us happy. It's also BYOB and that is a huge plus. Besides the sushi, the staff and service were so helpful and friendly. I would definitely recommend this place for good Japanese food.

This BYO is great for delicious and cheap sushi.  

The spicy tuna tartar is fantastic...it's actually spicy, the tuna is super fresh and it's only 9 bucks.  The rock shrimp and almond chicken appetizers are also delicious.  I've gotten delivery from here a few times and it takes only 30 minutes or less.  In terms of sushi, I've only tried the sixers roll with shirmp tempura and spicy tuna which was pretty great.  It was a bit hard to choose a specialty roll since the list is pretty extensive, and they also have some Korean dishes offered on the menu as well.
Actually really good!  The entrance is misleading - you'd think it would be some cheesy little joint, but it's nice and comfortable inside. The sushi was wonderful and I really enjoyed it.  BYOB too.

Makiman is my local, go-to sushi joint.  I only eat vegetarian rolls, so take read review with that in mind.  In the past year I've probably eaten in about 10 times (you do not need a reservation but book on open table to get your open table points).  It is BYOB, it is quiet, the servers are all very nice, and the sushi chefs work quickly to get fresh food to your table.  I've ordered take out another dozen times and delivery once or twice as well.

I usually get the avocado maki and the veggie tempura roll.  The rolls are always well constructed, though the veggie tempura roll is about three bites and somewhat difficult to eat (about the size of an 8 year old's fist--if I had to guess), but delicious.  The avocado is always ripe and fresh.  The wasabi seems to me to be a bit mild,  so keep that in mind when using it to accompany your sushi. 

They also have a large specialty roll menu. Make sure you check all check in apps to see if they have any specials.  Last time I did, it was buy one specialty roll, get one free.  Right now Makiman is offering 10% off orders when you check in on Yelp.

The BEST sushi and BYOB place in center city Philadelphia. My husband, friends, and I walked in the door to a warm, inviting, modern atmosphere. We had a party of 9 and expected the place to be small and cramped in like every other sushi place in the city but to our surprise the place had enough room to accommodate several large groups. We had a great long table next to the window. Of course a few from my party were late for our reservation including myself but the waitress was very accommodating and always had a smile on her face.

My husband and I started out with a Tuna Nacho-one word: AMAZING! ,Tuna Tar Tar-very flavorful, and the rest of the party was very satisfied with their appetizer selections. Another thing that was a surprise to me was that they had a large selection of hot dishes other than just sushi.

We also ordered the following over the course of the night: McNabb roll- a must try!!! ,NEViking roll-  delicious!, Sixers roll- my husbands favorite! Capn crunch and Lobster roll- very good, and one of my GF ordered the Unagi Bi Bim Bop- Its like the best of both worlds Bi Bim Bop and eel (VERY TASTEFUL). The green tea ice cream is a must have to end the night here.

Over all the sushi rolls we ordered were fantastic and very fresh tasting. Everyone agreed the preparation of the sushi is of high quality and I have to say the portions were great too. Most of the dishes looked really pretty and had real orchids on them (it was almost too pretty to eat!) If you want good sushi then this is the place to visit!!!

A very enjoyable experience!  (our first time at Makiman)

 We tried the ginger salads, miso, edamame, and a tuna roll (a crunchy one, which was delicious) - then went on to a sashimi deluxe platter.  We found the fish to be very fresh and all in all, we really enjoyed our dinner.

Love the fact that you can BYO wine, too.

THINK IT"S TIME TO GO BACK! :)

I'm pretty particular about my sushi but Makiman has always passed my exacting standards. Their NE Philly location was my go-to spot when I lived around the corner from it, but now that I'm in the city primarily, this Spruce St location is where it's at. Monday night is all you can eat sushi. Yes I judge a Japanese restaurant by its miso soup, if you don't get it right, you aren't worth your stock (get it?) But anyway, needless to say, Makiman does a fine job with their miso. But of course what you want to know about are the rolls, right!? of course! there's so many I haven't tried them all, but the ones I have are always delicious, neatly prepared and very fresh. I usually go with the Sashimi platter which has never disappointed. Its a favorite for me and my friends. My rolls of choice are the Kappa Maki (cucumber) and the Negi-Sake (Salmon with scallions) those are personal favorites of mine and Makiman makes them just how I like. For dessert, ginger ice cream. The Center City location fyi has a great online ordering system for both dine-in and takeout.

I went here with a couple of friends and we all loved it! The sushi is FRESH and it's BYOB..YAY! What i loved most is "tuna nacho" so yummy too bad it's such a small portion, i think it comes in four pieces. They have very creative dishes and names. Some entrees the portions are big enough to feed two people, well that's if you are ordering sushi and other appetizers. So far I have no complaints about their food. Will definitely go back to this restaurant.

Makiman has become my go-to sushi spot in Center City.  Both the in-house service and delivery are on point, and the sushi is high quality and delicious!

When dining in, the staff is always friendly and I've never had to wait for a table.  Most recently, I came here with a girlfriend to catch up and our order was taken promptly and food was brought out quickly.  Our server even made it a point to wait until we were finished with our appetizers (shrimp dumpling soup - so good!) before bringing our sushi.  

Then there are the days that you just don't want to put real clothes on and would prefer someone to bring the sushi to YOU.  Online ordering is easy and delivery is fast.  Granted, I do live a few blocks away so they don't have that far to travel, but I was really impressed with how quickly it arrived.

Price point is a little higher than some of the competitors, but I think the quality of the food is worth the extra cash.

I had sushi delivered from here at 9pm last night.  The woman on the phone was very pleasant.
  I ordered the MM Naruto roll, salmon with cucumber roll, miso soup, and green tea ice cream with whipped cream. 
Everything was DELICIOUS and the portions were good.  I highly recommend all of the aforementioned items.  The fish was very FRESH. All the rolls sound awesome!  I can't wait to try...blind date, NE Viking, sixers...etc.

The food came really fast, too.  The delivery guy also came right to the door, which makes me happy.

It was my first time ordering, otherwise I would have given it 5 stars.  I really can't understand where any of the negative ratings come from?

I've never left a one star yelp review, and I've never had a bad tuna roll.. Until tonight.  My wife and I each ordered the "sushi deluxe" - which is 10 pieces of sushi plus one tuna roll.  

Before the plates even hit the table, they smelled like old nasty fish.  Like the Italian market on a hot sweltering day.  

I hoped the smell came from a new piece of sushi that we weren't familiar with yet, but no.  Everything was terrible, even the tuna and salmon (which is usually always so reliably tasty).

This is seriously the worst sushi place I've been to in center city.  Very disappointed.  Left most of my plate untouched and had to go across the street to get a sandwich at Jay's Deli afterwards.

The other annoying thing was that the waiter went into hiding after we told him it wasn't very good.  He wouldn't make eye contact afterwards, and we had to hunt down an employee after waiting 30 minutes for the check.

This place is the worst.

Came here before heading to the Kimmel Center.  We were immediately seated and provided water.  Our service was good, except that we had 2-3 different waiters helping us at any given time.  It was slightly confusing at first, but did not take away from our experience.  

The food was good.  We got a few special rolls, an eel handroll (very good), and a yellowtail/cucumber roll.  We also got the veggie dumplings and the seaweed salad.  The food came out in a timely fashion and we were easily on time for our show.  I would definitely come back here when seeing a show on Broad St.

Do I like it raw? Yes.
Do I like terrible service? No.

I previously ordered take out from Makiman. Being satisfied with my order, I decided to dine in the following week with my partner. The Futo Maki roll was my favorite, but ended up falling apart due to it being insufficiently rolled. The rest of my rolls were pretty average. 

I would've given Makiman an average review, but the service made me feel very unwanted. 

Our server was completely apathetic. We were their only table and we still felt unwelcomed. They did the bare minimum while serving us, which I would expect if the restaurant was busy - but c'mon, we're only a two top and we're easy to please. 

After dining, I asked them about the 10% off Yelp check-in offer. Our server was completely oblivious and asked their coworkers. I overheard one of them saying "I don't know, just pretend that you don't know what Yelp offer they're talking about." Not a direct quote, but still, if you're going to be sarcastic/throw shade at your customer, do it AFTER they leave. Also, do they not know how sound travels, especially in an empty restaurant? Common sense now! They ended up taking the Yelp offer, but I rather would have saved my 10% for better service. 

I would also like to note that our server did not have their hair (which was way past shoulder length) pulled up. Isn't this a minimum requirement for servers?

Word of advice: Since you have a "People love us on Yelp" sticker, please be aware of the offers you put on your Yelp page.

I came here after purchasing a Living Social deal.  I *j'adore* sushi but have never been able to find a sushi joint in the city limits that I liked...

You guessed it... until now.  Love the fact that it's a BYO, it's smallish inside but there were 2 big parties when we went and yet my boyfriend and I could still hear each other great.  The sushi was excellent - fresh, the right texture and firmess, the only disappointing thing was that they were out of toro but, I guess that gives me a reason to go back! (We had the tuna and yellowtail rolls, a spicy tuna, the ebi and the salmon - all so YUM) The miso soup was warm and satisfying on a cold rainy night - just the right amount of tofu and seaweed - and thankfully no huge tofu chunks which always puts me off.  Edamame was like it had just been picked.  Steamed to perfection with a little salt for taste and the house salad with the homemade ginger dressing - O.M.G.  I used the dressing as a dip once the salad was done.

All in all, I am a huge fan of this joint and cannot wait to go back - AND I thought the prices were really reasonable.  Especially for center city.

"Chef recommends!"

Comfortable atmosphere. Good food. Fast service. 

Went it with a Google Offer and ordered three rolls and dessert. 
I tried a Philadelphia Roll, a Sweet Potato and Broccoli Roll, and a NE Viking Roll. All three were delicious, but the winner for me was the simple Sweet Potato/Broccoli Roll. It was ridiculously delicious. Philadelphia Roll was still awesome and pretty much tasted like a bagel with 1/4 of the carbohydrates. The NE Viking Roll was rather good, but a bit too expensive to order again. 

Green Tea ice cream was excellent as well. 

Great service and very helpful staff. They helped me learn how to use chopsticks :).

I love coming here as a way to keep the husband and I both happy -- he wants sushi, I'm meh, so I always fall for the bibimbap. Plus, dumplings!!

We tried Makiman a few visits ago on a Groupon and it went so well that we've gotten a little into it, despite having lots of other options closer to our house. The menu is pretty extensive, so I'm happy taking people here, and did I mention dumplings? Dumplings.

I especially like Makiman as a pre-evening out dinner, as it's so close to Broad Street and all the theater/art/music action there without the crowd. I've also seen huge groups come here without trouble (although I assumed they had a reservation).  We'll definitely keep coming back!

I think I've been spoiled by Sumo Sushi.  I probably would have given this place a better review had I not experienced the party in my mouth that is Sumo Sushi.  I had the dumpling soup, and split 3 specialty rolls with my friend.  It was so average compared to Sumo that I just can't give it higher than 2 stars.  If you're jonesing for some sushi, do yourself a favor and when you get to 13th and Spruce, just walk another block south to find the best sushi I've found in the city.

Tuna Nachos... Mmmmm

Ordered three rolls (in order of my faves): Blind Date, Sixers Roll, and the raw NE Viking Roll - all were quite delicious.

I will be back.

This is a review for their all you can eat...Monday only from 3pm onward. The fish is fresh but the rules are a bummer. 3 orders at a time...they are pushing you toward ordering the rolls. Can you imagine getting only 6 pieces of nigiri per order?!? They is no way in hell you can eat a large quantity. Another rule is that you can't order the next round until you are totally done. If you want lots of sushi for all you can eat, expect to spend hours here. If you want all you can eat, go to aki instead.

I wish I could give this place zero stars.  
1.  Service was incredibly slow even though there weren't many people here.
2.  There was VERY little meat in every dish we ordered -- two rolls and a Korean dish.
3.  The salad we got had pieces of rotten lettuce in it.  It wasn't edible.

I wish this place would go out of business because it's doing Philly a disservice.

Last night was my second visit to Makiman, and I was very impressed both times.  Both times I was also with large groups (10+) and the staff couldn't have been nicer/more accommodating, even when my group last night got quite loud after many glasses of sake and wine.  I don't remember my waitress's name from last night, but on my first visit, Malik waited on us and he was great.  Unlike other reviewers, I do not think the sushi was small or overpriced in the least.  I ordered two rolls last night and couldn't finish it all, and I am a really good eater.  My total bill was 25.35 for a ton of food (we also split a bunch of edamame) - to me, that is a fair price for a nice, clean place with friendly service and great sushi.  In my two trips I've had the McNabb, Eagles, Sixers, tuna/avocado, etc.  All really tasty - wonderful fresh fish and produce.  They take reservations, it's a BYO, and I would definitely recommend it for large groups.  They can handle it.  Makiman is awesome and I will definitely be back!

We went on a Saturday night after deciding that we need a quick sushi fix that is affordable and fresh. Huge plus that we get to being our own wine! Yes, finding a quality byo that can seat you on a Saturday night is so golden. And I got just that. (So lucky, I know)

We were promptly seated upon arrival and had our wine bottle opened. We were so hungry!!! We ordered fried kimchi dumplings, miso soup, seaweed salad, spicy tuna sandwich, spider roll, Naruto roll, yellow stallion roll to share between two of us. Did I mention we were hungry? Yes. 

Everything was very tasty but the highlight was definitely the Naruto roll. Cucumber wrap filled with fresh tuna, salmon and crab stick was more than enough fix for the sushi need. Also, the service was very quick and friendly!

One negative was a very large group that was dining when we got there...really loud and since the restaurant layout was pretty open, we were not saved from all the laughter, and borderline screaming of the conversations. So if you're looking for a quiet and intimate night out, I wouldn't go on a Saturday night. 

Otherwise, please pay a visit! I can't wait to go back and try out more items on the menu...there are an extensive list of specialty rolls that must be tried!
Great sushi!  If you like rolls, that is the place to go. The sushi was fresh too.  I had my birthday dinner there with the girls and we had a great time.

Went to Makiman Sushi for the first time a few days ago, and now I am just wondering when will we go back again. It was very good!

To start I wanted to try their clam soup, but they ran out of it, so I went with the pork dumpling soup, expecting something kind of boring (even though I still wanted to have just some soup). Well no, surprise...great flavors, dumplings were delicious, the broth was so tasty, overall best dumpling soup I have had so far. We also had some seaweed salad, felt fresh.

Then we had some rolls. The salmon avocado cucumber roll, simple yet very tasty. Out of the fusion sushi rolls, we had the Ne Viking roll and the Menabb. Both superb.  We usually keep it simple when eating sushi, but the menu is so extensive, that I am willing to take a risk and try other stuff when we go back.

The place was packed (thanks to living social) yet service was efficient and very friendly.

Will definitely go back.

I went here with my girlfriend and my parents.  They were visiting from Cleveland and they had never had Bi Bim Bop.  The bi bim bop was good, but was ordinary and average, AT BEST!  I ordered the mexican role (sushi) at the waitresses request and it was pretty good.  We had edamame for the table and it was well prepared.  Sushi size was average, Bi Bim Bop size could easily feed two people.  Served with soup and salad.

Went in at around 3:30/4pm on a Sunday and was the only customer in the restaurant. They tucked me away in a corner and completely neglected me for the entire meal, I had to get out of my seat to request more water as the waitresses and bartender chatted in the back.

I came in specifically to order the ramen burger. It comes in a foil wrapping to hold it together. The ramen noodles are fried to a crispness so it tasted less like noodles and more like a thin crunchy bun. There is a barely cooked egg that covers absolutely everything in yolk which smells really strong and makes for one of the messiest meals in my life. I honestly don't remember much of the taste other than the egg yolk.

It might be easier if they give up on making the ramen burger something you eat with your hands and just present it as a fork-knife meal.

Good service and very quick.
BYOB (always a plus) 
The sushi menu is pretty big and they have good deals (3 rolls for about $16.00). Also a good selection of the Special Rolls! Not the best Sushi in the city, but never disappointing either, especially for the price. Try the Sixers Roll! Would have given another star but I feel like they are a little stingy with the actual fish in the rolls.... 
They always have Groupons or Living Social deals out, but even with out one its not too expensive.

My roommate and I are repeat orderers of Makiman via GrubHub; everything is always super fresh. From their Veggie Tempura roll to Bibimbap, everything I've ever tried has been seriously great and their delivery is always here within less than a half an hour (our delivery guy is like 60 and he rides a scooter)! Their other location is just as good. I don't normally dine like this, but I really don't feel the need to order from elsewhere else right now.

The only downside is one of their hostesses on the phone who must have sashimi in her ears. We tried to correct our order over the phone with her a minute after submitting it and spotting a mistake. When the order showed up x2 as wrong as the way we submitted it, she told me it was my fault because I'm the one who said it that way, which wasn't true. She was very quick to imply that I was wrong before hearing me out. Not appreciated, phone sashimi girl!

Phone sashimi girl sucks, but the sushi is great!

We picked this place because it was BYOB and we gotten more than what we expected.  Once we arrived, the table was ready for us.  The place wasn't huge, but there were plenty of room and not feeling cramped.  The server attended to us the moment we sat down.  She opened our bottles of wine and chilled them right away and best of all NO CORKAGE FEE.

The menu was easy to read.  They have the traditional sushi and sashimi plus they have many new creative fushion dishes.  I especially LOVED the Tuna Nacho, so much flavor and crunchy.  All the sushi rolls were beautifully presented.  The McNabb Roll was very creative and delicious.  There was also this tropical roll with mango which was very refreshing.  Another creative dish that they have was the Unagi Bi Bim Bop with eel. This is one of those that was so simple like adding 1+1 together but how can I not have thought about it?  I  had many Bi Bim Bop before, but I never really like the crispy rice part because most were to burnt.  This place made it perfect.  Just slightly crisp but not too hard or burnt.  

Overall, service and food was great.  Friendly Staff and Delicious Food, you can't go wrong.  We had a pretty large group and we were there for a very long time even after we finished all the food, but they didn't rush us or anything.  Some of my friends lives in the area and were excited that they deliver.  I would definitely come back to this place.

Ordered delivery from here on a Tuesday night through Grubhub. Estimated about an hour for delivery and they hit the mark pretty close.  My first impression upon unwrapping the food was:  why are these rolls so tiny, and did they really need to give us soy sauce packets?

The fish was of pretty good quality, the yellowtail particularly being the freshest I've had in a while, but my major issue with the sushi was the rice.  It was all wrong: hard, bland, cold, but thankfully not abundant.  Thinking about that rice still makes me shudder; it ruined the whole experience for me.  The fish portion in the rolls is pretty generous aside from the rolls being somewhat smaller than I'm used to, but there was some unevenness to their slicing technique so a few pieces were all rice and avocado with hardly any fish.  

Altogether we ordered dumpling soup, yellowtail scallion, salmon avocado, salmon cucumber, tuna avocado, a rainbow roll, and a special roll I can't remember.  The soup was not very successful.  The dumpling wrappers became mushy and fell apart in the broth, the filling wasn't very cohesive, and the broth was overly smoky miso-flavoured without the cloudy deliciousness of a good miso soup.  

Ely enjoyed his special roll the most, and from looking at other reviews and the photos on their hardcopy menu that the delivery guy brought, this seems to be their forte.  However, I find the lack of quality in the standard roll offerings to be a definite deal-breaker, as when I order sushi I'm not interested in spending $10+ dollars/roll for rolls filled with fried things and spicy mayo.  Terryin has not yet been overthrown as our go-to sushi delivery joint even despite their recent quality issues.  If I'm going to get hit-or-miss sushi, I'd rather spend a dollar less per roll.

Came here for dinner last Friday, seeing the four star yelp review I figured why not, it's always good to try new places, right? Wrong!  The space itself is fine, there is also outdoor dining which is nice, its a byob which is a plus, but the sushi was simply not very good.  I ordered a spicy salmon and a yellowtail roll along with some other specialty roll, they all tasted the same, pretty bland and too sticky, much like whole foods sushi.  Service was fine though.

3.5 stars

Although we were already pretty stuffed from our really late lunch at the Reading Terminal, we still found it necessary to add in an extra meal, which we called dinner... but it was really like a second dinner since our 'lunch' at Reading Terminal was so late, and so... large.  Even though almost no one was hungry, we went and ordered lots of food - edamame, agedashi, lots of rolls, and even dessert.

We brought our own wine since it's BYOB.  The Sweet Potato and Crab Tempura Roll was interesting.  I think the food was pretty standard, nothing extraordinary, but it was good.  

Service was also good.  We had a good time.

3 roll lunch special with miso soup.  YES, a go to sushi place....finally! I should have taken a picture.  
It is really hard to find a sushi place that's consistently great.  First I loved raw, then Fuji mountain, and now Makiman.  I don't think I'll be switching it up anytime soon.  
Not only is their sushi über fresh, but the menu items really appeal to me, and I feel the prices are very fair.

Makiman Sushi holds it down near the Kimmel Center on Spruce Street. They also have a location in Northeast Philly as well. On Mondays, they have an all-you-can-eat sushi special (you know what that means - but a deal is a deal). Pro tip? It's a BYO! So with a bottle of Beringer Sauvignon Blanc in tow, the GF and I stopped for by dinner.

Salad

We got one of the larger party boat specials, which came with salad to start. This came dressed with standard ginger dressing that was slightly watery, atop field greens, carrots, and cucumber. Some of the pieces of lettuce were a bit wilted, but other than that - fairly standard.

Spicy Tuna Tartare [$9.95]

The tuna tartare had good flavor, but was a bit too finely 'chopped' for my liking. There was nice texture from the crispy tempura chunks throughout and tobiko helped to provide nice bursts of flavor as well. 

Vegetable Tempura [$6.95] 

While the tempura was a bit over-battered and could have been crisper, the veggies were well-seasoned and fresh.

Rock Shrimp [$9.50] 

The rock shrimp's batter was better - crisp and well-seasoned. The juicy shrimp was tossed in a sauce that nicely balanced between sweet and spicy. 

Miso Soup

The miso soup was pretty standard with small cubes of tofu. The broth wasn't overly saline, which I appreciated. 

Party Boat 1 [$34.95]

The Party Boat 1 was plenty of sushi for 1. A bounty was on offer, including maguro (tuna),  kurodai (black sea bream), sake (salmon), hirame (fluke), hamachi (yellowtail) with scallion/yuzu, suzuki (striped bass), sweet ebi (cooked shrimp), and saba (mackerel) with jalapeno to temper the mackerel's intensity. Overall, the sushi was fresh. We also received "white tuna," which was really escolar (which I love due to the high fat content). The tobiko and pickled ginger helped to offset the fattiness.

California Roll 

We also received a California roll, which was standard, but the GF loves its simplicity.

Uni / Sea Urchin [$6.50] 

I had to order the uni, which had decent butteriness, though didn't taste especially fresh.

Sweet Potato Roll [$5.50]

The GF always craves the sweet potato roll (won't lie - I love it too). This particular order was especially starchy and wasn't crisp - a let down. 

The service was friendly, though wasn't completely knowledgeable. Perhaps we came on an off-night, but the sushi rice was a bit too cold and seemed over-cooked and overpowered some of the sushi. Makiman Sushi offers an affordable option for sushi in the city, but there are definitely better BYO options out there.

Good service, but very average sushi. Sushi was pretty good, but nothing amazing. I wouldn't go out of my way to come here. The sushi roll I like the most was cooked (Bulgogi roll). Overall, there are better sushi places in the city.

"Do you like it raw?" the menu asks me as I first gaze upon it. I ordered the McNabb roll after my favorite former Eagles footballer, and it was as delicious as Donovan was in his prime. This restaurant is great for groups, love the BYOB, and I definitely love it raw

I had heard a lot about this place when it opened but didn't get a chance to check it out until recently. All in all I had a good time there, the waiter knew what he was talking about and suggested some great dishes. 

We bought a bottle of wine and our waiter immediately threw it in an ice bucket and was rather attentive to our needs all night. good experience. def check it out if youre in the area.

Tried this with a groupon for the first time last nigh.  Never again.  The poorest service I've ever had in the city: ignored upon entry- took forever to be seated in an empty restaurant. It then took forever for someone to take our order... at which point, they got it wrong. I had to wait an additional 20 minutes for them to get the right order.  The starter came after the mains (I had to remind them to bring it) and it took forever to get a drink..or a napkin...or...anything. 

Food was so-so. Not terrible- not that good. Only 4 shrimp on the shrimp tempura dinner... Bi bim bop in hot stone bowl...served in a tepid bowl. 

Never again.

Groupon saves a lot of asses, including this place.

Maybe 2 stars, but the service sucked. 

I didn't have high expectations, and still I was disappointed.

Service is slow and somewhat apathetic (I didn't know who our waitress was for 15 minutes, water took another 15... etc) to the point that I wanted to go old school Korean and tap my chopsticks on the empty glass of water. The table in front of us was not wiped down until right before a customer came (which was almost at the end of our meal).

Appetizer: the tuna nachos- promising, but too much sauce and not enough fish. 

We got the Sushi Boat for 2, the McNabb roll, New England Roll, Shrimp Tempura Maki roll, and all were just blah. If I had to choose, the best of the 3 was the McNabb.

The salad that came out looked like the dressing and the components were all assembled in the morning (it looked flat). The miso soup was just OK.

THE SUSHI IS NOT FRESH. It looked and tasted like it's been precut and been sitting out for a while. The salmon sushi was odd (I should've taken a picture of it) because it was sliced so thin that the rice was showing between the fenestrations of the fish.

Luckily, we had a Groupon. Otherwise, I would've been considerably angry after my meal.

It's no secret that my bf and I love sushi - it became such a problem that (without telling him) I put a temporary ban on sushi consumption because jeez does it add up on my bank statements! But to convince him to accompany me to the Kimmel Center's free holiday tuba concert, I enticed him with the promise of a sushi dinner. 

We've passed Makiman Sushi endless times but never tried them because I don't like how some of their special rolls are priced (seriously, combinations are not that unique and cost more than at most other places, but in particular you pay waaaaay more for raw - ridiculous considering their slogan is "Do You Like It Raw?"!). But Makiman is right across the street from the Kimmel and since we had limited time to go from the concert to dinner to a holiday party we went there. 

The servers were really great, very friendly and eager to explain the menu if we had questions. We didn't want to spend too much, which influenced our choices. I had miso soup (fine) and my bf had the pork dumpling soup (yum!). We shared the tuna tartar, which was tasty, and three rolls: blind date, tiger, and a vegetable roll I can't remember. The rolls were fine, nothing special, and the fish quality was good but nothing to squeal over. The rice was kinda...meh...and there was too much of it. With rolls like these, I should be able to fit the whole thing in mouth tiny mouth, but I had to either bite a few in half or remove rice from the exterior. At the end of our meal, my bf turned to me and proclaimed that he never wanted to eat there again. I countered that if we were ever in a group where some wanted sushi and others didn't, Makiman would be a good compromise AND would probably be able to seat a group for sushi, unlike all of the small sushi joints elsewhere. So now I know that we will probably never, ever get sushi from there again, and I can live with that. There are more than enough choices with better fish, better special rolls, and better or at least equal prices.

Walked past this place probably a thousand times without a second glance. 
After my instagram pals foodchasers left a photographic review I had to try for myself, and I must say I'm glad I did,  I have been here multiple times since and my favorites are most certainly the  MM Naruto, Eagles, Boston, and Tropical storm rolls. Very reasonably priced for the quality and portion sizes. Next time I plan to try the ramen burger as it has tempted me during past visits. I also love their tag line and wish to buy the shirt, "Do you like it raw?" Very funny.

I have been going to the Makiman in the NE for a few years. Since moving closer to center city, I was excited to hear that a Makiman was opening in center city. The food is just as good if not better than the one in the NE. We ordered about 8 rolls and every roll was very good. The Sixers rolll (shrimp tempura on inside and spicy tuna on outside) was one of my favorite.  There was also this Mamma roll that was very large and had egg in it- it was nothing like any sushi that ever had  and it was amazing and unique. I also loved the Sweet Potato roll. I've also never heard of an Atkins roll and wasn't sure about it until I ordered it. The Atkins roll is a hand roll and is made up of fish and radish (instead of rice); to my surprise this was delicious. 

Makiman has a very large selection of sushi and other meals. Prices are reasonable. Service was great. It's byob which is great but they do charge a nominal cork fee (which I never encountered at the one in the NE and don't remember seeing that on the menu). I was there on a Friday night and the crowd was mostly young adults and it was pretty busy so I recommend reservations for weekends. I will definitely be back.
They have a great lunch special...5 pieces Sashimi and a roll for 10.95...sea urchin sushi was good...miso soup not so good..overall good service, fresh sushi, great deal

The first dish was served with rancid oil
The order was wrong
The fish tasted fishy
The soy sauce was "off"
The rolls didn't taste right. 
The mochi ice cream was even bad. I didn't think you could screw something up that comes from a box
They were nice and took the rancid order off the bill, but I would never come back. Probably the worst sushi I've ever had.

My first trip to Makiman was eat-in. Service was good enough. Servers in t-shirts made me feel like I should be in a much more casual-looking place, but I won't hold it against anyone. The food was good, but sad. One special roll was tiny. Another was huge, but the two ends of the five-piece roll were barely filled and fell apart. The yellowtail-scallion roll was cut into long pieces so all I could taste was nori. Meh.

My second trip was take-out. The eel/avocado roll was decent but I've had better. The Philadelphia roll was a mouthgasm and earns a star just by itself. The seaweed salad, a staple in my sushi meals, was soggy and too lemon-y and I didn't even want to finish it, which says a lot. Meh.

I agree with other reviews that the ingredients are, indeed, fresh. But my experience so far has been as bland as this review.

Great food.  Reasonable prices.  Volcano roll is amazing.

Would give 5 stars but service is slow.  And when it isn't slow, it seems like the waiters are trying to kick you out.

At first I was reluctant to go to this sushi place because of its silly name but I went after my friends persuaded me. I'm not a big sushi fan and didn't know what to order. A waitress named Chau was very helpful. She helped me pick out what is good and explained what fish are in which rolls. She knew a lot about sushi and explained to me the difference between rolled sushi and nigiri sushi. My dinning experience was great. I will go back the next time I crave the NE Viking roll.

Back in March, we were trying to figure out where to go to avoid both the amateur hordes of St Patrick's day drunks, and the short attention span cheering of march madness. After some discussion, the answer struck us; Sushi!. Our party of five wisely made a reservation, as we arrived to find only two tables unoccupied on a busy Friday night. We had to wait a few minutes while the hostess quickly prepared one for us.

Makiman seems a bit of a tight space at first. There isn't much of a lobby or waiting area, and the front door pretty much puts you right into the center of the restaurant. There are two slightly separated dinning areas, each with about a half dozen tables, and another sushi bar area further back. Once we were seated, it didn't feel quite as small, and impressively the overall noise of the room didn't make conversation impossible. New guests arriving do end up waiting right in the middle of everything,

It's a BYO, and our server spotted my bottle of sake and asked if I wanted it heated, which I declined, instead asking for it to be chilled with our beer. As an aside, if you bring sake, check how it should be served, like wine different types of sake are served differently. She brought out the appropriate glassware and we started opening our bottles.

The soup and salad were pretty much par for the course, the usual miso soup and seaweed/microgreen salad you get at most sushi places. We also started with an appetiser of spicy rock shrimp tempura, which was fantastic, the sauce, tempura batter and shrimp were well balanced and didn't convey the greasiness of everyday tempura.

For entrees, most of the table chose a mix of rolls and pieces, but I went for the Chirashi. It came out with several generously sized pieces of several different sashimi, including tuna, salmon, shrimp, octopus, among others. It was well presented in an angled bowl atop a good amount of sushi rice, ginger and wasabi. Each type of sashimi tasted fresh, but I thought the salmon and tuna were the best of the group.

Another friend of mine chose one of the bi bim bop bowls, and that will certainly be something I go back for. They have several different options to choose between. The various rolls I saw around the table certainly looked tasty as well, and I managed to trade for one or two to confirm that.

We also chose to go with deserts, and both the banana tempura and ice cream proved a good choice to split. On a future visit, I'd definitely recommend the banana tempura. Also, we enjoyed the wooden boats being carried out filled with sushi, which would be a fine choice for another time.

The bill was reasonable, and being a BYO you can bring in ample sushi or other drinks to enjoy with your meal. Given the location, Reservations are probably a must over the weekend. They also do takeout and delivery it seems.

This is one of the hardest ratings I have had to come up with. My experience can definitely be summed up as hit or miss. 

HITS: outdoor seating, BYOB, the shrimp tempura, 

MISSES: the quality/freshness of fish, corking fees, service

I checked this place out because I had a groupon but don't think I will be back. Maybe I caught them on a bad night but the fish didn't cut it especially with all the other options around town. Looking at "are these photos helpful" none of the presentations for my rolls came close to those quality. In conclusion, yes I have experienced better.

I have eaten in here twice - both times with a voucher, and gotten take out once. 

The service is great, and the restaurant is really cute. It's a BYO which is nice, and they will bring out stands and buckets for wine/beer. The sushi is great, don't get me wrong - but the rolls are small. A normal spicy tuna or salmon and avocado only has 6 pieces. If the prices were cheaper accordingly, that would be fine - but they are on par with all of the other sushi places that give you 8 pieces.  Some of the special rolls only have 5! 

The take out was fast, only 15 minutes- and they deliver too, which is a plus. 

For dessert, try the fried banana and icecream - very tasty and a pretty big size.

Since school is almost out for summer, I intend to come here next week for lunch and try the lunch specials - since they are such great deals, it won't matter too much that the rolls are smaller.
Came here for lunch, got the lunch special. The salmon nigiri was very good and fresh :)

Just got back from dinner here with the boyfriend. We wanted to check this place out because of the Groupon we purchased back in December.

The boyfriend got the Bi Bim Bop with Eel that also came with a salad and soup.
I got the NE Viking Roll.
Both dish were pretty satisfying. =)

The dishes here were pretty spicy but pretty good so I think I would come back again.

Oh, and all the waitress and waiters were pretty young which I don't know why but it surprised me. Our waitress was nice though. =)

There were actually more people than I expected to be there.
And parking was hard to find!

You won't find the most amazing sushi or service here, but it's a decent BYO place for a casual night out. I came here recently with 2 of my girlfriends. We had no trouble getting a reservation on a Friday night. There were actually only 2 other tables eating there the whole time we were there. 

The service is pretty awful, as echoed by many of the yelp reviews before me. It took a long time for any server to come over to greet us. We had to flag one down after about 15 minutes to get some water and a bucket for our wine. The servers do the bare minimum here- took our order, dropped our food off, gave us the check. The one plus is that they let you sit for as long as you want.. I appreciate that they didn't rush us out, so that we could finish off all of our vino! Also no corking fee which is pretty standard for a Philly BYO. 

We started with the edamame, which was typical and good. Not a huge portion, but enough for the 3 of us. We then each got the choose your own makiman special which is 3 rolls plus miso soup and ginger salad. This was a good deal and a lot of food for the price. The miso soup and ginger salad were both very standard, nothing to fault there. The rolls I got were shrimp tempura, spicy tuna, and salmon and avocado. They were fine for basic sushi but nothing special. I wish the spicy tuna had some tempura flakes to add some texture. 

Overall, this was not somewhere I'd rush back myself, but wouldn't mind going if someone else suggests it.

It's nice to know that you can find a sushi serving BYO in Center City that's fresh & tasty and not horribly priced for the location.

The sushi was good (NE Viking Roll was particularly ohm nom.)
The server - attentive but not overtly so.
The atmosphere wasn't cheesy or too trendy.  
Clean bathroom, FTW!

When we arrived just before 6, the place was empty - but it was hopping by the time we left.

Definitely would go back - and would try the Korean food too!

Acceptable sushi. Shared the: salmon, yellow fin tuna, striped bass sushi, California roll, miso, and shumai dumplings. The shumai came cool, which was a bit disappointing. Nothing extraordinary with the sushi, but not bad either. Worth a trip and remember it's a BYOB

Had lunch here with a work colleague.  I got a variety of sushi fish a la carte.  It proved to be an expensive way to sample the menu.  Nothing stood out.  The yellowtail, salmon, and sea urchin, for example, were all solidly average.  If I were to return, I would go for one of the lunch deals, which seem to provide fair value.  Decor is standard-issue sushi joint with dark wooden furniture.

If you search Yelp for Sushi in Philadelphia, Makiman is number 3 of the 153 matches.  This is a really good rating and Makiman was only a few blocks from my hotel so I thought I'd try it.  Maybe my expectations were too high, because I thought it was just a bit above average.  I'd give it a 3.5 and I'd go back, but I think I would rather check out a few other places first.

I was sitting at the sushi bar and I avoided ordering any generic white fish because a few pieces looked old and dried out at the edges.  I was able to see what I was going to be ordering and all of the nigiri and maki were good.  Service was a bit weird, three different people wanted to take my order and later when I needed the tea refilled, no server was around.  The guy working the sushi bar would have taken care of it, but he was busy and I didn't want to bother him.  If I caught them on a bad night, their good nights are probably very good.

Solid sushi BYOB. I have eaten at the restaurant and had delivery. Every time it has been very good, reasonably priced, convenient location, usually never busy for a weekend night dinner. It is a go-to BYOB spot. Went one night with friends and drank many bottles of wine and were there for awhile but they did not rush or hurry us up. They let us just hang out which was nice. 

I always order the rainbow roll, spicy tuna, and salmon avocado rolls. No complaints they are always great! And they have brown rice if you ask. 

For what it is, it is a great spot!!

I feel bad leaving two stars for this place because my lunch partner recommended it, but I wasn't impressed. 

The restaurant was nearly empty at lunchtime on Friday, which seemed odd. There was one server working and he was running around the whole time so we didn't see him very often. We had to call out for water refills and flag him down for the check. 

I ordered a special roll with spicy tuna inside and torched salmon outside, plus a king crab roll. It's pretty unlike me to not plow through my sushi, leaving no trace, but I actually didn't even finish my rolls. They were fine, but not exceptional. My friend had a few of the larger special rolls and the pieces were cut so large she actually ended up choking on one - thankfully, she was fine.  

The final nail in the coffin was when I went to wash my hands in the restroom and saw how filthy it was. I will not be returning, or ordering from this establishment, again.

I really have tried to like Makiman. It is right around the corner from my boyfriend, and I have eaten and gotten take out a handful of times, but have never really been satisfied. Their food is very affordable, and if you don't mind settling for low quality sushi or just okay bi bim bop, you may be okay with Makiman. If you expect more than mediocre, you should probably try somewhere that isn't located in a shopping plaza.

Haven't tried the sushi yet, but I had been looking for a decent place to pick up Korean food for lunch.  Just got bibimbop and must say that it's pretty good!  

I'm picky with Korean food because I won't pay for what I can make at home.  I've been looking for a decent Korean restaurant in Center City (for lunch), but the other Korean restaurants that I'd been to in Center City were just 'eh'.

Makiman Sushi has very decent bibimbop.  The lunch bibimbop comes with a side miso soup. I'm looking forward to trying other things on their menu.  Too bad they don't have a large variety of Korean food--I guess it's primarily a sushi place.

It was really fun sitting at the bar, watching the roller and seeing all the fresh fillets of fish.  The guys who work here really take pride in what they do and are eager to answer the questions of newcomers to sushi... like me.

Maybe you read my previous review I hadn't tried sushi in 15 years. So i was eager to try another sushi restaurant.  Again, everything was delightful!  Presentation was excellent and the service was extremely considerate.

We came in later at night, maybe around 10. The restaurant is a byo and there was a large party of girls behind us.  They were very very loud, but really nothing for which you could blame the restaurant.  I can't wait to go back.

BYO
outdoor seating
delivers

Went there on a Monday night for all you can eat sushi, $27+tip/tax which is a little expensive for the quality. First order the waitress forgot my order while everyone at my table had theirs. The sushi has toooooo much rice. I only order a few things but I was too full from all the rice.  The quality of sushi? uhh most sushi places in the city are okay, I love how everyone is like, this place has the best sushi place or the freshest fish... but seriously unless you are going to morimoto or zama, you probably aren't getting the creme of the crop sushi. That being said, the items offered for the all you can eat is very limited. There weren't many special rolls offered and if there were, there were far from special.

There was a 30-minute span of when our vase of water was empty. Seeing how we had a group of 7 and all you can eat sushi/ soy sauce can make you thirsty, the waitress should at least knowledge to give us water. Every other all you can eat sushi places have hastily refilled our water. When we asked to split the check for each person, the waitress looked all bitchy. Well that's what you get for shit service.

So I ended spending $36 for awful sushi with too much rice... the rice wasn't even good, some of it was not even cooked thoroughly. With $36 I could have a delicious  meal at yakitori along with some imported beer during happy hour or their specials.
